lead_paragraph: Influential officials from the International Olympic Committee accused the United States committee of refusing to renegotiate its “immoral” share of global Olympic revenues, reopening a dispute that could harm Chicago’s bid for the 2016 Games. Under a long-standing deal with the international committee, the United States Olympic Committee receives nearly 13 percent of American TV rights fees and 20 percent of global marketing revenues — hundreds of millions of dollars. Discussions about reducing the share have failed to produce an agreement. “I simply do not understand how you can justify that the rest of the world has to pay for the training of American athletes,” said Hein Verbruggen, a Dutch I.O.C. member.
